Experience Metrics and Reporting Analyst CB&I June 2015  – Present (3 months) Aiken, South Carolina As the Metrics and Reporting Analyst I am responsible for generating and reporting data in support of corporate and independent assessments. I assist the Director of Performance, Planning & Integration in performing field verifications, communicating with the Board of Governors, NNSA, MOX President and the Executive Team regarding special projects and on-going activities. I am also responsible for identifying cost, planning, scheduling trends and suggesting corrective actions. 
I collaborate with the Director of Performance, Planning & Integration in performing special projects for the Executive Team, NNSA, MOX President and Board of Governors, generate data, compile reports and create presentations using credible, accurate information. I assist in the production of the project review meeting package, communicate and serve as a liaison to ensure the successful completion of goals, assist in performing field verifications, document the variances between actual vs. stated materials, and work closely with project stakeholders to review project schedules and other performance metrics to verify: 
• EVM (Earned Value Management) 
• Cost analysis estimates 
• Baselining 
• Earned Value 
• Planned Value 
• Actual Value 
• Performance Measurement Baseline  
I document and provide schedule analysis, schedule risk analyses and programmatic schedule assessments, develop and evaluate project performance metrics, support all Corporate and independent reviews including providing pre and post review documents, nondisclosure agreement (NDA) signatures, code of conduct (COC) signatures, presentations and system explanations, provide variance analysis and corrective actions and perform analyses of trends, develop reports, facilitate communication and provide feedback to customers. The Dealer Products & Services Metrics & Reporting Analyst is a dedicated mechanical insurance specialist providing operational reporting, data analysis, and analytical support, while working in partnership with other Ally DP&S divisions.  
Serves as the primary internal point of contact providing management and oversight of all related analytical and reporting duties with holistic focus on divisional relationships and effects on business partners.

Continually analyze and validate accuracy of data being reported and provide trend/early-warning analysis while teaming with analytics groups throughout Ally DP&S to produce guidance cognizant of impacts to all lines of Ally work streams. 
Serves as point of contact for the field staff providing targeted analytics and activity guidance.

Summary I completed my undergraduate education in three years and graduated with Latin honors. 
Since graduating in 2013, I have taken that same work ethic, passion, and dedication into my professional life. 
 
I often get the question, "Data, Analytics, Reporting... but weren't a psychology major? 
 
Yes, I was! The great thing about a liberal arts education are all the "bonus" skills you get along with it.As much as I love psychology, the intangible skills, work ethic, multi-tasking, leadership, and communication are applicable in any field, and I've found my passion in Big Data. 
 
Currently, I am an Advanced Metrics and Reporting Analyst at Prime Therapeutics. Presently, I am working on strengthening our reporting platform and implementing enhancements 
so we can continually offer the best service to our clients.  
 
Prior to that, I was a Reporting Analyst at Green Tree. During my time at Green Tree, I coded and developed several reports that had a direct impact on upper management’s 
decisions regarding multi-million dollar capital projects. I was also part of a special team tasked with developing enhancements to our in-house claims program so we can  
increase submissions. Between June 2014 and December 2014 we increased dollars submitted per month from $36 million to $90 million.  
 
 
My goal is to provide expedited solutions to ensure our clients have the tools they need, so our consumers can get the medicine they need to feel better and live well. Summary I completed my undergraduate education in three years and graduated with Latin honors.

Summary I am a customer focused analyst with a strong background in manufacturing and customer service. The past 8 years of my career I worked closely providing data summaries to the Director of Sales. The work involved the assembly of data from a variety of manufacturing data systems. 
 
I am currently a Metrics Reporting Analyst reporting to the PMO Manager at CSC working on the NY-Health Exchange project. Assembling weekly progress reports for presentation to the NY Department of Health. 
 
- Over 20 years’ experience driving profitable growth for North Americas largest soft-alloy extrusions organization. 
- Results-oriented, tenacious, analytical, and highly motivated pricing/data manager, able to achieve results in a very competitive market.  
- Experienced in profitable-growth. marketing, customer service, product design, and data analysis. 
- Well versed in the aluminum extrusion process. 
 
Specialties: Proficiency with Excel, Access, PowerPoint, FrontPage, Word, Microsoft Visio, Microsoft Map, pVelocity, Oracle Discoverer Reporting.
